data.text: @LouiseMartinCBC Don't forget to add the vaccine stats per case Louis.. looks like 79.3% are vaccinated that have covid on PEI.. please post all the info so we don't have misinformation https://t.co/lPj9nd1VZB

@themommagoat @65Robin @LouiseMartinCBC @CBCPEI Well said and helps me stay in check - Understanding today's world events has not been easy.

Playing the devil's advocate, and with a quick observation on all trends in this post, I would point out that, where as Egypt's rate has ~doubled, Israel and PEI have increased ~tenfold.

@65Robin @SandbarSinking @LouiseMartinCBC @CBCPEI I want to be  clear. Im not disagreeing with you. I am not a scientist or a doctor. I am interested in the theories and how people get to them and if is confirmation bias or if there is facts that can back them up. Just because my experience isn't the same, doesn't mean I'm right
@65Robin @SandbarSinking @LouiseMartinCBC @CBCPEI Egypt....besides Nigeria they have the lowest vaccination rate...same spike. https://t.co/i6ruZ3qhCF
@LouiseMartinCBC Well louisewhat are they going to do about it they should be doing something take the vex pass back

@plumberbuzz @LouiseMartinCBC The lower numbers of positive test cases in Ontario are because there are fewer people getting tested. Nowhere near full capacity like PEI. There are a LOT more unvacinated people in Ontario and a lot of people with symptoms aren't getting tested because of personal reasons,etc

@LouiseMartinCBC Why bother saying “6 in hospital” when there are only two there specifically with Covid? And both of those were just there for an examination…they’re not dying, not on respirators. Why make the uninformed even more panicky?🤷🏻‍♂️
@leets05 @LouiseMartinCBC This argument is all over the place 🤣🤣🤣 learn how to string together a coherent thought. 😂
@65Robin @themommagoat @LouiseMartinCBC @CBCPEI although, mine is PEI's total count whereas, the one you shared is Israel's 7 day average
